author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like *eventually*, Ethereum's technical debt will cause it to fall behind competitors despite its large developer mind share.  Do we have any long term plans that will allow us to do some green field development free from the constraints/restrictions of our history?  Perhaps sharding is such an opportunity, as each shard can *mostly* have its own set of consensus rules (I haven't followed sharding closely, so maybe this isn't a good fit)?
